title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of showers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts.

title: Trump, Musk feud explodes with threats of cutting contracts, backing impeachment
byline: President Donald Trump threatened on Thursday to cut off government contracts with billionaire Elon Musk’s companies, while Musk suggested Trump should be impeached, turning their bromance into an all-out brawl on social media.

title: Body of woman who died under mysterious circumstances found in Dombagahawela
byline: The body of a woman who died under mysterious circumstances was found inside a rock crevice in a forest in Dombagahawela, Monaragala.

title: Strike by Supplementary Medical Professionals continues for second day
byline: The trade union action initiated by five paramedical professions under the Joint Council for Professions Supplementary to Medicine (JCPSM) will continue for a second consecutive day today (June 6), according to JCPSM General Secretary, Chanaka Dharmawickrama.

title: Locomotive Operating Engineers to halt coastal train operations today?
byline: The Sri Lanka Railways Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union has announced its readiness to withdraw from operating coastal railway services starting at 12 noon today (June 6), in protest over unresolved issues related to the malfunctioning signaling system.

title: Power disruptions reported in several areas of Colombo and Kalutara
byline: Several areas in Colombo and Kalutara experienced power disruptions earlier today (June 6) due to a tripping of the Biyagama–Pannipitiya main transmission line, the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) confirmed.

title: Former Minister Mervyn Silva indicted before Colombo HC
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva has been indicted before the Colombo High Court in a case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), alleging possession of undisclosed cash and assets exceeding Rs. 800 million.

title: Tom Felton to reprise Draco Malfoy role in Broadway’s ‘Harry Potter and the Cursed Child’
byline: Tom Felton is to reprise his role as the villainous Draco Malfoy in the Harry Potter stage show on Broadway.

title: Gayantha Karunathilaka withdraws from committee investigating Dayasiri
byline: Chief Opposition Whip Gayantha Karunathilaka has withdrawn from the three-member committee appointed to inquire into a complaint regarding the conduct of Attorney-at-Law and Member of Parliament Dayasiri Jayasekara.

title: ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ passport case: Asst. Immigration Controller and 2 others granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of three suspects, including an Assistant Controller of the Department of Immigration and Emigration...

title: SriLankan Airlines flight makes emergency landing in Indonesia
byline: SriLankan Airlines flight UL 306, which departed from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for Singapore last evening (June 5), was forced to make an emergency landing at Medan Kuala Namu International Airport in Indonesia due to a technical issue.

title: Indictments served against ex-Minister Chandrani Bandara
byline: Former Minister Chandrani Bandara has been indicted today (June 6) before the Colombo High Court on charges of corruption.

title: Planned coastal railway strike temporarily suspended following talks
byline: The Sri Lanka Railways Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union has temporarily suspended its planned withdrawal from operating services on the coastal railway line, which was scheduled to commence at 12 noon today (June 6).

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa further remanded
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, has been further remanded until June 13, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Three including DMT Deputy Commissioner further remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the further remand of three suspects, including a Deputy Commissioner of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT), who were arrested on suspicion of accepting bribes amounting to nearly Rs. 4.2 million.

title: MP Dayasiri Jayasekara appears before CID
byline: MP Dayasiri Jayasekara appeared before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this afternoon (June 6) to record a statement.

title: SriLankan sends special relief flight to Sumatra to transport passengers of grounded plane
byline: A special relief flight, UL 302, has departed from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) to Medan International Airport on the Indonesian island of Sumatra to transport 101 passengers and crew members of SriLankan Airlines flight UL 306, which was grounded due to a technical fault.

title: President stresses timely completion of urban development and housing projects
byline: A progress review meeting on the projects implemented by the Ministry of Urban Development, Construction and Housing under the current budget allocations was held today (06) at the Presidential Secretariat, under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Musk’s Starlink receives licence to launch satellite internet in India
byline: Elon Musk’s Starlink has received a licence to provide satellite communication services in India, as confirmed by sources. This makes Starlink the third company to obtain such a licence from the Department of Telecom (DoT).

title: Sri Lanka’s remittance inflow exceeds $3 billion in first 5 months
byline: Sri Lanka has received USD 641.7 million in workers’ remittances in May 2025, according to the latest figures released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Modi inaugurates world’s highest single-arch railway bridge in Kashmir
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has inaugurated the world’s highest single-arch railway bridge in Indian-administered Kashmir. The term “single-arch bridge” typically refers to a bridge with a single, continuous arch spanning between two supports.

title: New Chief Secretary appointed to Western Province
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed K.G.P. Pushpakumara as the Chief Secretary of the Western Province.

title: Sri Lanka moves to integrate all sectors associated with tourism industry
byline: A discussion aimed at identifying strategies to attract tourists during the offseason was held this afternoon (06) at the Presidential Secretariat, chaired by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, with the participation of key stakeholders in the tourism industry.

title: Tom Cruise is awarded Guinness World Record with fiery ‘Mission: Impossible 8’ stunt
byline: Tom Cruise is now a title-holder for a daring stunt he performed for the latest installment of the “Mission: Impossible” franchise.
